steps.title: Navigate to the content you want to copy in Windows.
steps.content: Navigate to the content you want to copy in Windows. This can be any application or text from a web page.

steps.title: Highlight what you want to copy and press Ctrl+C.
steps.content: Highlight what you want to copy and press Ctrl + C . You can also go to Edit > Copy once you've highlighted what you want to copy.

steps.title: Go to the Cygwin window and right-click a blank spot.
steps.content: Go to the Cygwin window and right-click a blank spot. The keyboard shortcut Alt + Tab will allow you to change active windows while right-clicking prompts a menu to pop up.

steps.title: Hover your mouse over Edit and select Paste.
steps.content: Hover your mouse over Edit and select Paste . The content you previously copied will paste into the window.

steps.title: cp <filename> <new filename>
steps.content: cp <filename> <new filename> . This will create a copy of a file.

steps.title: cp -R <directory> <new directory>
steps.content: cp -R <directory> <new directory> . This code creates a copy of a directory.

steps.title: mv <filename> <new filename>
steps.content: mv <filename> <new filename> . This moves or renames a file.

steps.title: cd <directory>
steps.content: cd <directory> . Will change the directory you're currently in.

steps.title: ls
steps.content: ls . This lists the files in the current directory.

steps.title: ls -l
steps.content: ls -l . Lists all the files in the current directory as well as their attributes.

steps.title: mkdir <new directory name>
steps.content: mkdir <new directory name> . This creates a new directory.

steps.title: pwd
steps.content: pwd . This tells you what directory you're in.

steps.title: tar -zcvf <filename> <directory> # create gzipped tar archive of <directory>
steps.content: tar -zcvf <filename> <directory> # create gzipped tar archive of <directory> . Pick one of z,c,v,f to execute a command. -z - filter the archive through gzip -c - create a new archive -v - verbosely list files processed -f - use archive file

steps.title: tar -xvzf <filename> # extract tarred, gzipped <filename> in current directory
steps.content: tar -xvzf <filename> # extract tarred, gzipped <filename> in current directory . Pick one of x,v,z,f to execute a command. -x - extract files from an archive -v - verbosely list files processed -z - filter the archive through gzip -f - use archive file

steps.title: chmod u+x <filename>
steps.content: chmod u+x <filename> . Pick one of u+x to execute a command. -u user -+ adds permissions -x executable rights
